Ursula, I had asked about the Real Time EVP Recorder, and the subject moved=
 to SB7.
=C2=A0
Jerome gave his take on the device, and I was wondering if =
anyone else had bought and tried it.
=C2=A0
The recorder is at this site. h=
ttp://unknownmagazine.com/cubecart/Equipment/Digital-Recorders/RT-EVP-Inter=
active-Digital-Voice-Recorder/prod_1336.html=C2=A0
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
Michael Ed=
wards.=C2=A0Please join The Worldwide Radio Sweep EVP Alliance
http://www.f=
acebook.com/group.php?gid=3D102193593178906
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0

---=
 On Sat, 10/23/10, Ursula Kalin <kalinu@...> wrote:


From: Ursul=
a Kalin <kalinu@...>
Subject: Re: [RTSC] RT-EVP
To: RTSC@yahoogro=
ups.com
Date: Saturday, October 23, 2010, 9:24 PM


=C2=A0 





oo I thoug=
ht you were talking about the RT-EVP device..I saw Ghost adventures using t=
hat one I think alot of static which I guess suppose to be white noise




=

From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
To: RTSC@yahoogroups.com
=
Sent: Sat, October 23, 2010 5:07:18 PM
Subject: Re: [RTSC] RT-EVP

=C2=A0 
=


=C2=A0I'm not saying it doesn't work, I actually have an SB-7, and that d=
oes work, I just don't like the step sweep, plus both AM and FM are not ver=
y sensive. I have recorded messages off the SB-7.=C2=A0 I like the size.
=
=C2=A0
=C2=A0F-S


On Sat, Oct 23, 2010 at 4:01 PM, Ursula Kalin <kalinu@sb=
cglobal.net> wrote:


=C2=A0 





I'm not surprised to hear that it doesn'=
t work 





From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
To: RTSC@yaho=
ogroups.com
Sent: Sat, October 23, 2010 4:55:48 PM
Subject: Re: [RTSC] RT-E=
VP


=C2=A0 


=C2=A0I don't know what is so hard to comprehend about using=
 linear sweep, not the crap step sweep that these people think is so great.=
 I know for a fact all the components are available SMT. Even digitally con=
trolled potentiomenters for sweep adjustment are available.The makers of th=
ese devices hype them like it's a super advancement.=C2=A0 The SB-7 works, =
after a fashion, but the entities will use what I use, and the messages ten=
d to be broken up.=C2=A0 I like the small size :-)
=C2=A0
=C2=A0F-S
=C2=A0
=

=C2=A0
On Sat, Oct 23, 2010 at 9:32 AM, Jerome Finley <jeromefinley07@gmai=
l.com> wrote:


=C2=A0 




I really=C2=A0didn't like=C2=A0this device=C2=
=A0at all, it had no redeeming qualities=C2=A0and it took me about 5 minute=
s of working with it=C2=A0before I decided I would never use it again. 
=C2=
=A0
There were so many problems with this thing;=C2=A0my opinion is that=C2=
=A0it's little more than an over-hyped, glorified digital recorder and a cr=
appy GB (if it can even be called that). 
=C2=A0
The scan rates weren't at =
all to my liking (too restrictive)=C2=A0and the antenna for the=C2=A0sweepi=
ng radio=C2=A0is contained within the earphones, not=C2=A0the actual device=
=C2=A0(meaning if you don't want to use the earphones you can't use the swe=
eping radio/GB functions).
=C2=A0
As a recording device the RT-EVP is just =
"okay." For the money one could invest in a much=C2=A0nicer digital recorde=
r without all of the hyped up features and you would=C2=A0be much better of=
f (again, my opinion). 
=C2=A0
After this RT-EVP, the (P) SB-7 and a few ot=
her=C2=A0devices=C2=A0I've pretty much sworn off of ever using commercially=
 produced, mass marketed ITC devices again.=C2=A0
=C2=A0
Equipment=C2=A0tha=
t comes straight off a factory line often feel "cold", impersonal=C2=A0and =
alien to me. There's almost a lack of love, attention and intention one can=
=C2=A0sense when using=C2=A0them and it affects my communications, definite=
ly. I much prefer devices that are made one at a time, go through their own=
 testing and modification process, allows for adjustment,=C2=A0can be custo=
m tailored to fit the individual needs of the researcher using them=C2=A0an=
d aren't shipped out=C2=A0by the hundreds or thousands to make a quick buck=
 off=C2=A0the (relatively) new=C2=A0"GB Craze."=C2=A0
=C2=A0
There's no way=
 I could recommend this RT-EVP device to anyone in good conscience. Sure, s=
ome will get (possibly below average) results with it - I've no doubts abou=
t that...but is it the best choice for your money and a great piece of equi=
pment?
=C2=A0
I don't think so; not by a long shot. ;)
=C2=A0
-JF
=C2=A0
=
=C2=A0=C2=A0

<DIV> I don't know what is so hard to comprehend about=

ly controlled potentiomenters for sweep adjustment are available.The makers=

orks, after a fashion, but the entities will use what I use, and the messag=

<BLOCKQUOTE style=3D"BORDER-LEFT: #ccc 1px solid" class=3Dyiv1291713=

<DIV style=3D"BACKGROUND-COLOR: #fff"><SPAN> </SPAN> 
=
<DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>I really didn't like this device&nbs=
p;at all, it had no redeeming qualities and it took me about 5 minutes=
 of working with it before I decided I would never use it again. </DIV=
>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>There were so many problems with this thing; =
my opinion is that it's little more than an over-hyped, glorified digi=
tal recorder and a crappy GB (if it can even be called that). </DIV>
<DIV>&=
nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV>The scan rates weren't at all to my liking (too restrictiv=
e) and the antenna for the sweeping radio is contained withi=
n the earphones, not the actual device (meaning if you don't want=
 to use the earphones you can't use the sweeping radio/GB functions).</DIV>=

<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>As a recording device the RT-EVP is just "okay." Fo=
r the money one could invest in a much nicer digital recorder without =
all of the hyped up features and you would be much better off (again, =
my opinion). </DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>After this RT-EVP, the (P) SB-7 =
and a few other devices I've pretty much sworn off of ever using =
commercially produced, mass marketed ITC devices again. </DIV>
<DIV>&n=
bsp;</DIV>
<DIV>Equipment that comes straight off a factory line often=
 feel "cold", impersonal and alien to me. There's almost a lack of lov=
e, attention and intention one can sense when using them and it a=
ffects my communications, definitely. I much prefer devices that are made o=
ne at a time, go through their own testing and modification process, allows=
 for adjustment, can be custom tailored to fit the individual needs of=
 the researcher using them and aren't shipped out by the hundreds=
 or thousands to make a quick buck off the (relatively) new "GB C=
raze." </DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>There's no way I could recommend =
this RT-EVP device to anyone in good conscience. Sure, some will get (possi=
bly below average) results with it - I've no doubts about that...but is it =
the best choice for your money and a great piece of equipment?</DIV>
<DIV>&=
nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV>I don't think so; not by a long shot. ;)</DIV>
<DIV> =
</DIV>
<DIV>-JF</DIV>
